Fully Custom Profile

Fully Custom Profile contains any model's intial values you add. Model initial values define the initial values for the corresponding inports of VVT offset in a system definition file.

What do you want to do?

Add VVT offset

A VVT offset may or may not be available for this profile. If a VVT offset is available, to add the VVT offset, click the Add VVT Offset button. You also can right-click this item in the configuration tree and select Add VVT Offset from the shortcut menu.

Remove VVT offset

A VVT offset may or may not be available for this profile. If a VVT offset is available, to remove the VVT offset, click the Remove VVT Offset button. You also can right-click this item in the configuration tree and select Remove VVT Offset from the shortcut menu.

Change the number of teeth for this profile

To change the number of teeth for this profile, select the parent section in the configuration tree. The Fully Custom Profiles page appears to the right of the configuration tree. At the bottom of that page, modify the numeric control named Number of Teeth.

Set the tooth configuration for this profile

FPGA Simulation Angle Reference must be selected to match to the angle reference that is being used inside your bitfile for your N teeth M missing loop.

To set the tooth configuration for this profile, modify the rising edge and falling edge of teeth provided in the control Tooth Angles on the page below. Valid entries include numbers in the range from -720 to 720 if using the Cycle Angle reference and -360 to 360 if using the Crank Angle reference. The image at the right of the Tooth Angles control displays how the configuration is interpreted. The line at the top represents top dead center.

View or change the VVT offset

A VVT offset may or may not be available for this profile. If a VVT offset is available, to view or change the VVT offset, select the offset item in the configuration tree. The Channel page appears to the right of the configuration tree.

For more information about adding and configuring custom devices, refer to the Configuring and Running a Project book of the NI VeriStand Help, available by selecting Help»Search the NI VeriStand Help.
